alert.note: Alert for Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 10:40AM EST until March 17 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River and Wildcat Creek. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to the one to over two and a half inches of rain received from Saturday night through this morning. Minor flooding is expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MARCH 17... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes. * WHEN...Until Thursday, March 17. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural lands and some oil fields flood. Several township roads about 1.25 miles south of St. Francesville and River Road between Billett Road and Lincoln Memorial Bridge in Lawrence County are flooded. Extensive flooding of Kimmell Park at Vincennes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Tuesday /9:45 AM EST Tuesday/ the stage was 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CST Tuesday /9:45 AM EST Tuesday/ was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, March 16. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1045 PM EST /945 PM CST/.
